requirements.summary: Implement Team section with CRUD operations
acceptanceCriteria: Team members can be added with photo upload, role selection, and department text
Team members are displayed in a grid or list showing photo, role, and department
Existing team members can be edited or removed
Role options include: Faculty coordinator, Student president, Core member, Volunteer

file_operations.description: Create TeamSection component displaying public team members in a grid layout with photo, role, and department. Fetch team members using getAllPublicTeamMembers backend method. Use ExternalBlob.getDirectURL() for photo display. Use the icon-team.dim_128x128.png from frontend/public/assets/generated as section header icon. For admins, show edit/delete controls on each team member card.

Create TeamMemberForm component for adding/editing team members with fields: name (text), role (select with options: Faculty coordinator, Student president, Core member, Volunteer), department (text), and photo (file upload). Use ExternalBlob.fromBytes() for photo uploads with progress tracking. Call addTeamMember or updateTeamMember backend methods. Verify the blob-storage component's usage instructions before implementing file upload. Include admin-only guard check using isCallerAdmin.

Create custom hook useTeamMembers to fetch, add, update, delete, and publish team members using React Query. Provide queries for getAllPublicTeamMembers, getTeamMembersByRole, and getTeamMembersByDepartment. Include mutations for addTeamMember, updateTeamMember, removeTeamMember, and publishTeamMember with proper cache invalidation.
Wire TeamSection component into the main App layout. Position it after the About section. Ensure authenticated admins can access the add/edit team member form.

requirements.summary: Create Events section with Past and Upcoming subsections
acceptanceCriteria: Past Events display event name, date, description, multiple photos, and outcomes
Upcoming Events display registration link, poster image, and details
Events can be created, edited, and deleted
Past and Upcoming events are visually separated
Events are sorted by date

file_operations.description: Create EventsSection component with two subsections: Past Events and Upcoming Events. Fetch past events using getPastEvents and upcoming events using getUpcomingEvents backend methods. Display past events with name, date, description, photos array (using ExternalBlob.getDirectURL()), and outcomes. Display upcoming events with name, date, description, registration link (clickable), and poster image. Use the icon-events.dim_128x128.png from frontend/public/assets/generated as section header icon. For admins, show edit/delete controls.

Create EventForm component for creating/editing events with fields: name, date, description, photos (multi-file upload), outcomes (for past events), registrationLink (for upcoming events), poster (file upload for upcoming events), and isPast (boolean toggle). Use ExternalBlob.fromBytes() for photo and poster uploads with progress tracking. Call createEvent or updateEvent backend methods. Verify the blob-storage component's usage instructions before implementing file uploads. Include admin-only guard check.

Create custom hook useEvents to fetch, create, update, delete, and publish events using React Query. Provide queries for getPastEvents and getUpcomingEvents. Include mutations for createEvent, updateEvent, deleteEvent, and publishEvent with proper cache invalidation.
Wire EventsSection component into the main App layout after the Team section. Ensure authenticated admins can access the event form.

Use the icon-gallery.dim_128x128.png from frontend/public/assets/generated as section header icon. Support full-size image viewing on click (lightbox or modal). Wire GallerySection component into the main App layout after the Events section. Ensure authenticated admins can access the upload form.

Create custom hook useProjects to fetch, submit, update, delete, and publish projects using React Query. Provide queries for getAllPublicProjects and getMyProjects. Include mutations for submitProject, updateProject, deleteProject, and publishProject with proper cache invalidation.
Wire ProjectShowcaseSection component into the main App layout after the Gallery section. Ensure authenticated users can access the project submission form.
